results.title: Becoming aboriginal
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An exploration of the traditional education of tribal children in the aboriginal family. The same children are seen later in a formal classroom situation at Bamyili in the Northern Territory. To “become Aboriginal” these children must learn to survive in the bush, but also they must learn to survive in a world of European skills and values. Photographer: Andrew Fraser; Narrator: Gerry Bostock.

results.title: Becoming a student again
results.creator_credit: John Garrity and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: A motivational program aimed at putting mature-age students at ease with the idea of returning to study at TAFE colleges. Indicates the process of enrolment, the expectations of students and the TAFE colleges, and the problems likely to be encountered at home by mature age students.

results.title: Becoming a reader
results.brief_description: Presents interviews with various reading experts who indicate a positive approach to parents assisting their children in the reading process. Also shows the types of activities that may be applied by parents to encourage reading and writing.

results.title: Becoming a family
results.creator_credit: Martin Chilcott, Robert Page and Lifetime
results.brief_description: This program is about babies - having them, caring for them and watching them grow and develop. It is not only a comprehensive and practical guide to babycare but also shows what it is like to become a family and how people cope with the new relationships and feeling that a baby brings. It contains information on pregnancy, feeding, development, sleep, teething, cleanliness, safety and a host of other topics. It is designed especially to help you to enjoy the new life you have created by taking you into the lives and homes of new families who share their experiences (and babies) with you. The sections include: getting ready for a baby; pregnancy and birth (10min); the newborn baby - 0-6 weeks (32min); the settled baby - 6-12 weeks; the sociable baby - 3-6 months.

results.title: Becoming (2003)
results.brief_description: This work consists of 7 dual-channel installations. As viewers enter the exhibition space, they are faced by found footage of iconic performances delivered by seven popular Hollywood female leads and then paired with a version by Candice Breitz delivering the lines.

constellations_other.name: Sound and cinema
constellations_other.description: Beginning with one of the first films to be screened at the Palais (a Melbourne cinema with its own outstanding resident orchestra) the constellation celebrates sound as an integral part of the connection between moving image work and audience.

results.description:
Each actor’s lines of dialogue have been taken out of their narrative context, and the responses of the actors they play against have been eliminated. Each of these pieced-together performances is then paired with the Candice Breitz version of the same one-sided routine. Sharing the same soundtrack as the ‘original’, Breitz lipsyncs the same lines and uses the same gestures and expressions to produce a copy of the original.

This work consists of 7 dual-channel installations. As viewers enter the exhibition space, they are faced by found footage of iconic performances delivered by seven popular Hollywood female leads: Cameron Diaz, Julia Roberts, Jennifer Lopez, Meg Ryan, Neve Campbell, Reese Witherspoon and Drew Barrymore. On the reverse side of each of these screens, viewers will find an alternative performance delivered by the artist herself.
description_for_label:

group_siblings.title: Miriam Hopkins, Rouben Mamoulian and film crew on the set of Becky Sharp

results.title: Becky
results.brief_description: This is the story of a retarded child and how her parents and others cope and learn from each other. Special ways of training at home and school are shown and the possible need for specialised medical care is touched upon. Such children can emerge from the special treatment area and enter normal life. This poignant and yet cheerful family portrait tells us how one family successfully copes with having their child at home. No other credits available.

results.title: Bebert et L'omnibus = Bebert and the Bus
results.brief_description:
Bebert is a five-year-old boy who becomes separated from his older brother on a train. The precocious moppet observes the less-than-grown-up activities of the adults as he seeks to be reunited with his family.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre ; director, Yves Robert ; writer, Francois Boyer ; photography, Andre Bac ; Music, Philippe Gerard ; musical direction, Francois Rauber ; editor, Andre and Monique Isnardon.
Cast: Petit Gibus, Blanchette Brunoy, Pierre Mondy, Jean Richard, Michel Serrault, Jacques Higelin, Jean Lefebvre, Tsilla Chelton, Sophie Grimaldi.
